column1: Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
column2: Using regular expressions to expand self-closing HTML tags may lead to cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.
column4: This self-closing HTML tag expansion invalidates prior sanitization as [["this regular expression"|"relative:///html/scripts/jquery.js:3:16007:3:16079"]] may match part of an attribute value.

column1: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
column2: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.
User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped, otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require exponential time on certain inputs.
column4: This regular expression is constructed from a [["user-provided value"|"relative:///server.js:86:26:86:32"]].
